title: Prep Roundup, Oct. 9
text:
FOOTBALL 
South Hamilton wins first game 
The South Hamilton Hawks won their first game of the season on Friday, beating Woodward-Academy, 23-6. 
Running back Logan Klemp scored twice for the Hawks, scoring touchdowns on runs of one and four yards. 
Charlie Reiter also intercepted three passes for the South Hamilton defense. 
The Hawks are now 1-5, and will play South Central Calhoun next week. 
Ballard tops Bondurant-Farrar 
The Ballard football team beat Bondurant-Farrar, 49-23, on Friday night. 
The Bombers held a 14-10 lead midway through the second quarter before Hunter Wright scored on an 89-yard touchdown run. Ballard tacked on another touchdown before halftime for a 28-10 lead. 
The Bombers scored twice more out of the half for a 42-10 lead. Bondurant-Farrar scored twice, but could not close the gap. 
Ballard is now 4-3 this season, and play at Nevada next week. 
Norse roll East Marshall 
Roland-Story beat East Marshall, 26-7, on Friday night. 
The Norse are now 3-3 this season, and will play Aplington-Parkersburg next week. 
Don Bosco crushes Colo-NESCO 
Don Bosco dominated Colo-NESCO on Friday night, 64-6. It was the Royals’ first loss of the season. 
The Dons raced out to a 24-0 lead by the end of the first quarter, buoyed by a fumble recovery in the end zone for one score, and returning a punt 61 yards for another. 
Don Bosco added three more touchdowns in the second quarter for a 44-6 advantage at halftime. 
Colo-NESCO’s lone touchdown came from Garret Tiarks. He scored from three yards out in the second quarter. 
He finished the game with 16 carries for 40 yards, and caught two passes for 42 yards. 
The Royals (6-1) play English Valleys next Friday. Rules for posting comments
